name: chicagotribune
text:
Chicago’s new top cop got testy when asked about the city's violent weekend; so did Mayor Lightfoot when asked whether she still has confidence in him.

Here are today’s top stories in Chicago politics, from @byldonovan: https://t.co/llbi9cWhJQ

name: chicagotribune
text: COVID-19 cases top 100,000 in Florida as US sees surge in infections in states across South and West https://t.co/BLIkunyYGW

name: chicagotribune
text:
Since @RexHuppke moved to Chicago 18 years ago, there have been roughly 7,000 homicides. How can the city let the carnage go on?

“The rich and powerful of Chicago have the gall to claim this city’s heart is breaking. This city’s heart seems unbreakable.” https://t.co/PpzDlm2YpS

name: chicagotribune
text:
A Chicago Board of Education member denies a newly released state watchdog report that he did campaign work while on the clock as an auditor for the Illinois Department of Employment Security
https://t.co/8A1vMYG1A3

name: chicagotribune
text: The Illinois Supreme Court announced on Monday that it would recruit a chief diversity and inclusion officer, acknowledging a need to address racism and to address “frailties in the disposition of justice” affecting people of color https://t.co/pLsq7xsshz

name: chicagotribune
text: After George Floyd’s death, where does Chicago draw the line on police chokeholds? https://t.co/RDr059RstE
